intro: Trichera × norica, commonly known as the hybrid snowberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically blue or black when mature, which are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Trichera × norica thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant in gardens. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its attractive foliage and winter interest.
